storyInfo: An old Ursus man takes a Rhodes Island medic operator hostage, claiming to be an old acquaintance of Nowell's. Saved by the long-lived after losing everything, he claims he can repay the debt.

attributes.content: Ugh... *sob*...
attributes.name: Frightened Voice

attributes.content: C-Calm down, sir!
attributes.name: Flustered Voice

attributes.content: Someone has already gone to get Operator Nowell! I-If you could move that needle away from her temple—
attributes.name: Flustered Voice

attributes.content: I'm not moving until he shows up.
attributes.name: Wizened Voice

attributes.content: But I suggest you avoid making any sudden moves.
attributes.name: Wizened Voice

attributes.content: Otherwise, I can't promise my hand will stay steady.
attributes.name: Wizened Voice

attributes.content: *pant*—*pant*—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I-I'm here. Who's... what happened—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: —Huh?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Mr. Nowell.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: That's me. And you are...?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Operator Nowell is here, Mr. Eroshka! Can you put the needle down now?
attributes.name: Flustered Operator

attributes.content: Your name is Eroshka?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You don't remember me...
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I shouldn't be surprised. I've changed a lot since we last met.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I don't. But you wanted me, and I'm here. Can you let the hostage go now? You can have me instead.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'm coming to you, slowly. Can you let go of the girl?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Come alone and stop two steps before me. Then I'll let go of her.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: No weapons.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Be careful, Mr. Nowell...
attributes.name: Flustered Operator

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell puts down his Arts Unit and optometric equipment, gestures to the old man, and then starts walking forward.
One more step.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I've done as you said. Now—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Oh—!
attributes.name: Frightened Operator

attributes.content: Uh—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'm a man of my word.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: ...I came to Rhodes Island at the recommendation of an old client after I left Londinium.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Rhodes Island is a pharmaceutical company specializing in Oripathy research and treatment. They have branches and clinics in many places. That's why I've resurfaced.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Oripathy. Hmph.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You cure uncurable diseases now?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: That's outside the scope of my work, and beyond my abilities.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Right. You're an optician, not a doctor.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I've gained sufficient basic medical knowledge to save lives in the broad sense.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Someone who spent his entire life trying to die, now making it his life's work to save lives...
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Is this some kind of sick joke?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: It's no joke, Eroshka.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I've said a lot. What about you? You didn't do all this just to remember old times with me, did you?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: If that was it, you wouldn't have to threaten these kids. They would have brought you to me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Or are you simply being impulsive and dramatic, just like old times?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I never expected that would get you to recognize me so quickly.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Then why?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Because your people were taking down your tents and preparing to move out.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You know as well as I do why Oripathy clinics in Ursus operate like traveling circuses, ready to move at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Yes, Oripathy, the Patrol Unit, the civil rights situation... same old story. That's not my point.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I came as soon as I heard you were here, only to see your people packing up and getting ready to leave.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Only the girl I held up was working in the tent up front. She apologized to me and said that you weren't taking patients, because you were moving elsewhere.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You're right. I should have told her I wasn't a patient, asked her if there was a man named Nowell here, and to take me to him.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: But I couldn't wait.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: ...Have you been searching for me?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I said, I'm a man of my word.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Wait, go no further.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Get out of my way! Let me go back!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: I'm going back to them! Even if we die, we'll die together!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: There's no point.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Wh-What did you say?
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: What's the point of going in there?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I get out of the way, you go into the fire and die with your family... no one will ever remember what happened here.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: That's better than being the only one to live! I'm not a coward!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Surely you understand what true cowardice would be.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Someone has to suffer the consequences of choosing the wrong side. But if the 'silencing' has taken place before the Emperor's edict—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Then the worst that can happen to those who survive this human-caused tragedy is exile.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Wh-What are you trying to say?!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Is it not clear enough? They sacrificed themselves to protect you.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Protect me? Ha... hahahaha! Protect me!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: It was you, wasn't it? You're the one who killed them! And you say it was their choice, to protect me—
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: ...Eroshka. That's your name?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Alors, Eroshka. I'm just a traveling optician. I'm not even from Ursus, and I have no interest in intervening in your conflicts.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I simply came to repay a favor. Your father asked me to save your life, and I did. That's all.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Do you think I would believe your shit—
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: No, I thought you would be wiser. Impulsive and dramatic behavior is the privilege of the young, and you're not THAT young.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: ...I know it. It was you—it has to be you!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: How could you know so much, if you were really just a simple optician?!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Unless you were part of it to begin with...
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Yes, yes. That must be it!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: I'm going to kill you.
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: I'll kill you!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: You're welcome to try. You'll earn my gratitude.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The soot has blackened the Ursus youth's hands. Without a second thought, he raises his only weapon and runs it through the unmoving man.
The dagger misses the man's heart and becomes stuck several inches under his ribs.
Damn—
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Wh-Why didn't you dodge?!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Because, if you actually manage to kill me, that would be the greatest birthday present of all.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: If I hadn't forgotten my birthday... it's been... such a long time ago.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Do you think you could make your death less painful by taunting me?
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: I don't know. All you can do is, try.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Argh—*cough* *cough*
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Why—
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Why won't you die?!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: *cough*... hah.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Trust me, I've tried everything I can think of.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell forces down the blood that has rushed up his throat. He knows that his wounds will soon miraculously heal.
After a moment of stillness, he pushes himself up from the snow.
The pain lingers, but never on the surface.
...What?
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: I've seen many tragedies like this one, in Victoria, Leithanien, even Gaul. What has happened to you is simply a much cleaner imitation.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The snow will cover all dirty deeds.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Shut up—SHUT UP!!
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: You can hardly stand, Eroshka. Why not use that last bit of strength to hear me out?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I've seen all this because I've been cursed to live forever, until I find the one thing that I can never again possess...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You're telling me there's something you can't find, even with a power like that?
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Happiness.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I swear, if this is some kind of joke—
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: I came here, because I've searched everywhere I can for the one who cursed me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: But the more I see, the more pain I feel, and the further I am from happiness and the sweet release of death.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Therefore, I won't say things like 'at least you're alive'. It's nothing to celebrate. All I can say is, at least you have a choice.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You can walk into the fire, or kill yourself some other way.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Or, if you still blame me and want to kill me, you can keep living...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: And come to find me, just as I seek the one who did this to me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: No, don't... you can't go.
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: Where will I find you?
attributes.name: Angry Youth

attributes.content: To tell the truth? I don't know.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: All I can give you is a token.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Ooh la la...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I said I'd come to find you.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: This is the token you gave me.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Nowell looks at the object in the old man's hand.
It is a pair of glasses. The lenses have shattered; one side of the frame bears traces of repeated repairs, having clearly seen better days, while the other side seems good as new.
...You kept them.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Of course I did.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Did I tell you that I made them to try to end my own life?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I failed, of course.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell takes the glasses and pulls out the arm on the new side.
They look at the sharp, long needle inside.
You didn't, but I can imagine.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: And they say the men of Ursus lack imagination.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: If imagination is the only way to get through certain forms of suffering, then it's a power that few in this land lack.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: True. Only imagination, but for imagination...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You polished it.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Why? It wasn't just to hold up a young girl who knew nothing, was it?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I've been looking for you. You know what this means.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You're a man of your word. You want to kill me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Yes, but not entirely.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You've reached the age when you start to babble nonsense.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I know exactly what I'm saying.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You can choose to kill me, or you can choose not to. There is no room for ambiguity between life and death, nor is there a transitional state between them, most of the time.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell reinserts the needle into the frame and gives them back to the old man.
The man snorts.
What if I came to kill you, and save you too?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What if I realized there wasn't anyone in particular I could hate for that tragedy... and yet I was powerless to fight the greater forces behind it?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I had some connections to this land. Then I lost it all, and there wasn't even anyone I could hate for it.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Yet you remained obsessed with looking for me, as I was once obsessed with...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Because I was the only one who lived. I saw suffering, but I could do nothing about it. I was alive, but not truly so!
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Yes, I started to understand you. You saved me, and the thought of searching for you kept me going all these years. That's why I wanted to repay the favor.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I lived because I was cursed never to die. You lived because you were strong.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Strong. Ha, strong! Let's just say it was so.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: After you left, I was captured and sentenced to the mines, but had the good fortune to be conscripted before I came down with Oripathy.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: On the battlefield, I had my brushes with death, but each and every time I was the lucky one who lived...
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: That was when I decided I would find a method to kill anyone.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You found it, didn't you?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Yes... I think I did.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: There is a light in the old man's eyes that belies his age. He grabs Nowell's hands with fire in those eyes, and puts a glass bottle in his hand.
Nowell sees a cloudy liquid swirling in the bottle.
This is how I repay you, Nowell. No need to continue a hopeless journey in search of happiness. Drink it, and it'll all be over—
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I get my revenge, you get your release.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: In alphabetical order... E... Eroshka...
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: Found him! The electronic records were broken, but thankfully there were paper files.
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: Military backpack... bread, water bottle, two books, four medals, a photo...
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: Grey jacket with a pair of glasses in the pocket, and—
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: ...Two glass bottles filled with liquid?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: What's in the bottles? Were the bottles opened and examined, or was he asked to take a sip?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: No... damn it, no! He got through a needle as thick as a wheat stalk—who knows what's in those bottles?!
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: He's—
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: He's with Operator Nowell, who's not carrying his Arts Unit. I have to—
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: Mr. Nowell—Mr. Nowell!
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: She runs out in time to see the old man's punch find Nowell's chest.
Nowell does not dodge or block and stumbles back a few steps.
*cough*—!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Uh—
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: Mr. Nowell! Are you alright?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: What happened? Why did he hit you? Did he take out anything unusual...?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: The medic operator's attention turns to the ground, where a broken glass bottle lies, its shards and a dark mark resting in the snow.
...Huh?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: By the time she looks up, the old man has left the camp and disappeared from sight.
Are you alright, Mr. Nowell?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: Was there an altercation? Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: ...No, I'm fine.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: We—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: We just had some catching up to do.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Even you need time to think in the face of such temptation.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I understand. But we don't have much time.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: No, I'm just thinking...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What the right way to decline is.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You no longer seek death?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Each day I long for it, more than the day before.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Then there's no reason to refuse, unless you're a coward too.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Few would describe me as brave, but that's not the reason.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You know the only thing that can kill me is happiness, Eroshka. It was a rule that an arrogant, supernatural entity imposed upon me, along with my unwilling immortality.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Now, you claim to be able to break it with a bottle of poison.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: What if I told you that you could achieve the same by taking that needle out and putting it through my temple, or neck artery?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What...
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I am no longer immortal.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What are you trying to say?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I've seen the one who cursed me, and found what could kill me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The fact that I'm here now, saving lives... all of these are related.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: So you're trying to tell me that you got your revenge and found happiness here?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You found happiness in this bunch of daydreamers trying to cure the incurable?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You could say that, but the point is...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Death is already coming for me, Eroshka. If you insist that I drink this poison here and now, I will.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The choice is yours.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: That would not be repaying you. It's just killing you.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: But you'll feel better once you've found closure. There's just one pair of glasses that I still have to finish, for a girl called Katya who lives here...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Perhaps you can bring the glasses to her once I've finished them and drunk the poison.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'll write a will, making it clear that I took my own life.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: If there's a funeral, I hope you can make it.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Ha—
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Hahahahaha!
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Are you serious, Nowell? Do you think of me, the man who came to kill you, like some kind of wishing well?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I think of you as an old friend, of which I have very few.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Then you'll be disappointed, because this old friend isn't doing anything for you.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: The old man snatches the bottle back from Nowell, and smashes it on the ground before he can react.
Eroshka—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I came to you with poison, and you're still trying to save me, after all these years?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Save me, comfort me, help me. It makes you happy to be in such a position, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Well, you're not getting your wish.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You can't save me, Nowell, because neither disease nor weapons will kill me, only the inexorable march of age—
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: And if what you say is true, then you'll feel it soon enough.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Every word is true.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Whatever you say. I'll never know.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Why did you...?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Alors, when you said 'we don't have much time', what you really meant was... you don't have much time?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You knew your days were numbered. You came to me because—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Thanks to you, I've wasted half my life, never able to repay a favor or settle a score.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Of course, you've seen many ridiculous lives like mine, in your own long, long life.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: It's not ridiculous, Eroshka, only painful.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Pain is the only thing we really can grasp in life. What's truly ridiculous... is what brought us to this point.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: It's no shame to admit the existence of pain. If I can help—is there anything I can still do for you?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: There's nothing you can do.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: I can use the shards of the broken bottle, if you want.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: But I don't understand. If you didn't want to grant my wish, then you should have killed me here, non? Prevent any chance that I could try to save you—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: No. That's enough.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You know that saving lives is my life's work now.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Fine. Stand right there, and don't move.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: You changed your mind?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I said, stand right there—
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Ugh—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You're right. I'm not the one who's ridiculous, and I don't need your pity, Nowell.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: —Mr. Nowell!
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: We're square.
attributes.name: Calm Old Man

attributes.content: Mr. Nowell, Mr. Nowell?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Sorry, I was distracted. Did you say something?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You need to get checked, see if your ribs have cracked...
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: By the way, how are Katya's glasses going? We have to move along to the next town tomorrow morning.
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: They'll be done tonight.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Shall we go back inside the tent, then?
attributes.name: Meticulous Operator

attributes.content: ...You go first. I'll be fine. You know I heal quickly.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: But thank you for coming to get me. I just need to clean up... the broken glass.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Can't leave them lying here. Someone, or maybe a passing burdenbeast, might accidentally step on them.
attributes.name: Nowell
